utterance.text: <GAZEANDPOINT(student)> Is there a tool that you can use <GAZE(distance_tool)> to measure the distance?<GLANCE(student)> <GAZE(clicks)>
<GAZE(student)> How many meters are there in 1 km?
<GAZE(student)> How can you convert kilometers into meters?
<GAZE(student)> So, if there is 1000 meters <ANIMATION(metaphoricDichotomicLeft)> in 1 km, how many meters are there in /distance/?
<GAZEANDWAVE(compass_button)Is there a tool<GLANCE(student)> that you can use to figure out the direction? <GLANCE(student)>
<GAZE(student)Which way is /direction/?
So which direction could that be?

What could a /symbol/ look like on a map?

<GAZE(student)> Which tool could tell you <GLANCE(symbol)> the symbol? <GAZE(tools)>

Are there any tools that you can use to figure this out?
How can you figure out where /distance/ /direction/ is?
So, how can you know where /distance/ /interDirection/ is?
So, how can you discover where /distance/ /interSecDirection/ is?
/meters/ /interDirection/... Where could this location be?
So, /meters/ /interSecDirection/... Where could this place be?
/meters/ /direction/... Where could that be?

So how can you solve this?

I can tell you that 1 km has 1000 meters.
In order to understand how many meters is /distance/ on the map, you should look at the scale of the map located in your left side of the screen.
To measure the distance we should use the distance tool at the bottom right side of the screen.
You can use the distance tool to measure the distance between these two points. You have to click where you want to measure from and then double click where you want to measure to.
The scale shows you how much the map is enlarged to get the actual size you are looking for.
The scale of tells you how much smaller the area shown on the map is compared to the same area in real life.
Every map has a scale visible and you should always check it before start reading the map.

Maps can have different scales, depending on what people want to use them for. For example, large scale maps are better for showing individual buildings in detail because they only cover a small area of land. Small scale maps are ideal for travelling either by car or walking because they cover large areas of land.
Well, /interDirection/ is a special direction, so we also need to look at the compass in a special way.
Well, if you look at the compass you can see that /interSecDirection/ is an intermediate direction.
You see, /interDirection/ is an intermediate direction.
You can use the compass tool to understand the cardinal points. This will help you find the way.
To understand directions we should use the compass tool at the bottom of the right side of the screen.
You have four main cardinal points: North, South, East, and West.
/interDirection/ is an intercardinal direction, because is one of the four intermediate compass points located halfway between the main cardinal points.

/interSecDirection/ is a secondary intercardinal point of the compass. This is a direction between the main cardinal point and the intercardinal directions. I can give you an example: south south west is located between south and south west.
Directions such as south west are called intercardinal directions on the compass.

I can clarify the compass points for you: So, when looking at the compass you have four main cardinal points: North, South, West, and East. North goes up and South goes down, West goes left and East goes right.
The /symbol/ has a specific map symbol associated. If you look at the map key tool, you can see that it is represented by a /symbolIcon/.
